law.catch_line: Consent of a parent to guardianship may include a waiver of the right to notice of:...

section.section:
Consent of a parent to guardianship may include a waiver of the right to notice of:
the filing of a petition under this subtitle; and
a hearing under this subtitle.
Consent to guardianship entered into before a judge on the record shall include a waiver of a revocation period.

Whenever a local department receives consent to guardianship of an individual before a guardianship petition is filed, the local department promptly shall:
file the consent in the individual's CINA case; and
serve a copy of the consent on:
each living parent of the individual;
the parent's last attorney of record in the CINA case; and
the individual's last attorney of record in the CINA case.

Whenever a party obtains consent to guardianship after a guardianship petition is filed, the party promptly shall:
file the consent with the juvenile court in which the petition is pending; and
serve a copy of the consent on each other party.

Subject to paragraph (2) of this subsection, a person may revoke consent to guardianship any time within the later of:
30 days after the person signs the consent; or
30 days after the consent is filed as required under this section.
Consent to guardianship under subsection (a)(2) of this section is irrevocable.

text.section: If, at any time before a juvenile court enters an order for adoption of a child, the juvenile court finds that a condition of consent to guardianship will not be fulfilled, the consent or acquiescence becomes invalid.
